A careless agent encrypted the flag with RSA, but used a modulus that's the product of two Blum primes. Recover the message: 3910938797822608156217127045265858633546537196442628046720021858512729341879369818508275877161802773574270670957624652097294315358678563433616538347403595

The flag format is flag{...}
n=11988501732839974971039804848979167572978676609234004225894471805997586971985003141321706532213504959927937472671952415582742809822322398453752265589363701, e=6519349394722702939168445569581485252970871866164175417065199023745652921559070771111349356040209549941043896370870702096500492347257973963682846330626703
The lower 104 bits of p are: 28142553253303082918917992063310810163


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{15mblv44}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3910938797822608156217127045265858633546537196442628046720021858512729341879369818508275877161802773574270670957624652097294315358678563433616538347403595
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=11988501732839974971039804848979167572978676609234004225894471805997586971985003141321706532213504959927937472671952415582742809822322398453752265589363701, e=6519349394722702939168445569581485252970871866164175417065199023745652921559070771111349356040209549941043896370870702096500492347257973963682846330626703
The lower 104 bits of p are: 28142553253303082918917992063310810163

extra_info: p=109182234183428205340337752935908506772837287728681398694406363109124470524979, q=109802678269974460812149047230671318719009251192173713528611272788030482052919, Ï†(n)=11988501732839974971039804848979167572978676609234004225894471805997586971984784156409253129547352473127770892846460569043821954710099380817855110636785804
